You decided to show the device to the once bookish, now authoritative, Dr. Liara T'Soni. You met Liara years ago in a remote ruin that was falling apart. Most of that falling bit was due to your inventive means to quick-mining that kinda maybe sorta caused a cave-in. But that was too long ago for anyone to remember. Right? 1111.content:
"...Liara. Got a minute?"

Unlike most of the crew, you and the doctor worked on a first-name basis. You and her had known each other for years now, so keeping it formal just felt so... Impersonal. Normally you were fine with that, but seeing as how you were on a first-name basis with your entire crew since you all had worked together for years... Everyone tended to drop the military formalities around you and instead acting a bit more personal and relaxed. Not that you minded, of course; you were just Shepard, nothing more, nothing else.

"Shepard!" The blue-skinned doctor moonlighting as the mighty Shadow Broker looked up from her computers and meet your gaze with a welcoming smile. "Of course. What can I do for you?"

You responded to her smile with one of your own, and gestured with the device still in your hand. "I found this during our latest operation against Cerberus. Wanted to check if you can find out anything about it." The device exchanged hands - from yours to hers - and the doctor looked curiously at the meek device lying in her hand. Without warning, the instruction-sheet popped up, causing a startled reaction from both of you, but it didn't take long for Liara to gather her wits again and skim through them. "Interesting..."


"...Anything you recognize?"

"I'm afraid I haven't heard of anything like it, Shepard. I knew Cerberus had some cutting edge technology, but... No, I'm afraid I have nothing for you."

You were a bit disappointed, but not surprised. Throughout your short period of working alongside Cerberus, you hadn't gotten a good look at their tech. Important as you may be, but they never needed you to control any advanced tech that happened to be theirs.

But... Maybe Liara could find SOMETHING to look at? She was the Shadow Broker after all, so chances are she should be able to find anything that could potentially help them. She was good with technology to boot; maybe not as good as Mordin, but between the two he trusted her a bit more. Mordin wasn't untruthworthy - his morals were just a bit more... Blurred. Although, you could take the more risky route and try it out for yourself, have Liara tag along if she wanted to...

1113.content:
While studying the device, you came to realize; you could think OUTSIDE of the box, and spin the whole thing on its theoretical head. You could simply show Liara (and arguably, yourself) that the device actually worked! Granted, you'd be putting yourself at risk as a guinea pig, but you felt that it was worth the risk. The device seemed to be safe, and you couldn't imagine why Cerberus would keep it around to begin with if it could pose a threat to the actual user. ...Even IF it was recovered from a storage room filled with experimental weaponry that could turn practically anyone or anything into a glowing pile of dusty goo. Of course, the device wouldn't do so according to its instructions, but the thought didn't help matters. And IF it did actually really work, you knew that you at the very least were putting yourself in safe hands. Or at least, you imagined Liaras hands to be quite safe. While she still was the Shadow Broker, the infamous information broker, Liara was also just Liara, and Liara was (to him) a very kind and humble individual. If it came to the crew (or Shepard himself), she wouldn't let any of them come to harm if it were in her power.

Rising from your bed, you make a mental note to record something for Liara to explain the situation and not have her worry too much about the whole thing. Walking into a room with practically everything untouched and the occupants (presumably hollow) body lying on the floor would put everyone on high alert, and that wasn't your intention. Liara may read the instructions, but you doubt she'd do that BEFORE she called someone up or took the matter into her own hands. EDI was also around, but you weren't sure if you wanted to put all of the work on her and her programming. Of course, putting SOME of it on her didn't really hurt.

"EDI, first of all; please tell Liara that I wish to meet her in my quarters immediately. When Doctor Liara T'soni arrives in my office, please remind her to keep calm and read the datapad on my desk." You authorized to thin air, with EDI replying with a court "As you wish, Commander." to acknowledge that she heard your order. Part of you wondered why she didn't question the whole thing, but you shrugged it off as just being something about her programming.

You sat by the desk, device at your side, and opened up your datapad, granting your newest note open for anybody to read. Liara was the only one you wanted up here for this, and she wasn't the type to bring company (unless Glyph counted, but you weren't sure if you wanted to answer anything involving whether VIs could be considered something other than simply VIs right now), so you felt it best to not go through unneccesary security procedures.

"Liara, don't be worried about me; if you can notice the device next to whatever I'll be, please read its instructions and if if it's wished for, you are free to try me out. If you do, I wouldn't mind you documenting the whole thing, preferrably via video. You can probably ask EDI to fix that for you, she can probably fix that for you."

You saved the note as finished, and stood up in the middle of your room. Your entire body shook, growing more nervous by the second. "Right." You mumbled to yourself, "here goes nothing." For a second or two, you could see a red line followed by a dot placing itself upon your body, before everything went black.

She knew it was silly, but something about the whole thing felt off. If Shepard wanted something from her or just wanted to talk, he'd always go straight to her office, and vice versa if she wanted to talk with him. Both of them knew that they were free to do so, and because it was the most practical way of doing it it was what they did. With that in mind it was understandable why she found this to be a rather... unusual request. It probably meant that Shepard had something to show her, but couldn't he just bring it with him? Was it too heavy to carry with him? If so, how had he gotten it into his quarters? It felt suspicious, and the only real idea she could settle on was that it was a trap, or that he was hiding something he didn't want to risk the chance of revealing to anybody other than her. He had a brilliant mind, and probably realised the risks of whatever this was about. Even with that in mind however, she couldn't shake off the feeling of how unusual it was. She had never seen or heard of Shepard doing something like this before, not to anybody. He didn't like secrecy, so why was he acting this way?

Shepards quarters were oddly quiet, apart from the vibrant hum from the drive-core that could be heard throughout the ship. Shepard had never been a very loud individual , but the room still felt too quiet for anybody to be there. There was nothing that would indicate a living, breathing soul being in there, apart from herself. Of course, the answer as to why lied in the middle of the room in plain sight.

"By the godess!" was the only thing she could blurt out as she stared at the hollow skin of John Shepard lying in a pile on the floor. 1152.content:
You flirted shamelessly with Yeoman Kelly Chambers through most of your time with Cerberus. And she flirted just as shamelessly back. All that verbal jousting led to quite the night together before you stormed the Collector base. You had to pull a few strings to get Kelly back on the ship, but it was well worth it. You had grown accustomed to her tender touch. You definitely were not accustomed to her fist.

But at the moment, laying on the floor of the Normandy's boxing ring, her fist was all you could think about. That sucker punch she landed on your jaw took you completely by surprise. You had no idea that her small frame could pack such a wallop. But that was the joy of sparing. That was the the best part of boxing. You really got to meet a new side of someone by watching them fight. That kind of fight is how you won over the meathead James Vega. And you were discovering all sorts of things about an old friend while boxing the slim form of Kelly Chambers. You were impressed by the skill displayed. You had studied pugilism lightly, but you were clearly fighting an expert. And one hell of a pilot.

"Had enough, Commander?" Kelly's voice asked you sweetly as she extended a hand. "Would you like me to kiss it better?"

You laughed as you accepted the offer. Both of them. You wish you could have seen the look on Kelly's face when you planted a kiss straight on her lips. You'd trade that to see her blush after you felt up her fine ass shortly afterwards. You smirked as Kelly looked to you in shock. "What's wrong Chambers? Don't I get a consolation prize?"

You watched Kelly pause for a moment, glance at one of EDI's display modules, and gather itself. "I'm still not sure you didn't let me win, there's no way you're this bad at boxing. Best 3 out of 5." You nodded with a smile. You wish you had let her win. But it was quite the opposite. You had tried every dirty trick you knew. But your opponent knew more.

"Where'd you learn to fight like that?" You asked dumbfounder as Kelly's body assumed the starting pose and showed off her legs and legwork. "I mean, how?"

"King fu movies. And Rocky. That's about it." Kelly's expression looked a little too cocky for her face. It was one part of the illusion was wasn't dead-on. You had told Joker about the device and asked if he had any preference for a non-essential crew member to wear for a bit. And of course, Joker decided to try on the skin of Miss Kelly Chambers. And the first thing he wanted to do was work out as much as possible. Joker had been incapable of straining or impacting his body in any way without severely endangering his health for all his life. This suit somehow made his body strong and stable. And he was gonna enjoy every minute of it.

EDI, to her credit, was letting Jeff do as he pleased. She needed focus to run the billions of tests and re-tests on the Cerberus device you had found. As the boxing match, EDI made an announcement about the device on your private channel.

12.content:
Even with the very clear instructions in hand, Jane Shepard still felt clueless about the whole thing. She realised the potential the device had, but far too many questions were spinning around inside her head for her to focus on its potential. Was this reaper-tech? Was it purely Cerberus? Prothean? Some other species entirely? The possibilities felt endless, and all of them were plausible. It seemed to be meant for use during infiltration-missions, which sort-of ruled out the reapers; they didn't need anything like that, what with indoctrination. Cerberus could use it to cleverly infiltrate more xenophobic species to destroy them from the inside, and the Protheans probably used it for the same reasons, if it was from them. As for something else entirely ... If it was something comparable to those three, Shepard didn't even want to imagine its existance. They had problem as it already was, and really didn't need another galactic threat on their hands.

She sighed, and loosened her grip on the device. The safest bet was probably to lend it over to Liara and see if she had something that could link it to the Protheans, and/or give it over to Mordin for him to study. While he didn't share Liaras expertise on getting information and the Protheans, he was still one of the most brilliant researchers she knew. Then again...

Part of her ignored the safety procedures she had been trained to follow so many times before. If the device was able to cause great harm to users, Cerberus would probably not have it just lying around. Knowing them, they'd dispose anything that could pose a threat to themselves (or humanity in general, although that was something that could be debated). Surely there was no harm in trying it out for herself? ...Ah, what the hell.

Shepard promptly rose from her bed, and started to ponder again. Either she could follow along with the safe route like she first told herself to do, or try the thing out for herself. Even if she honestly felt nervous about it, she was still quite interested in what she could do with it. Nothing major, of course, just a little test. But with whom?

The ship was filled with all kinds of faces, ranging from humans like herself and everything from Quarians, Krogan and Turians! She had a lot to pick between, and being human felt like a wise choice, but the rather exotic idea of becoming an alien felt rather... Appealing, as well. While she could always try both, she was unsure on which to start with, and with whom!
12.title: Female Shepard!

No, you didn't want to put the team at risk like that. You could always ask, but that didn't help you much other than knowing you had consent. That'd certainly help your conscience, but it didn't help you with figuring something out the safe way. Couldn't you just ask some of the more tech-savvy members of the crew to help? Hm, now that you thought about it...

The... Rather 'quirky' Salarian was up to his wits in something when you entered his lab and nervously knocked on a nearby locker to get his attention. "Uhm, Mordin?"

"Shepard. Occupied right now. Unless it's important, please come back later." He seemed agitated, which worried you. You didn't mean to disturb, but the device felt important enough to bring up to him. Besides, Mordin didn't mind work; he struck you as a major workaholic, but... Maybe it was something really special? You couldn't see what it was, nor did you want to ask, in fear of outstaying your welcome (which you probably already had). "I was wondering if you could check this thing out..." You said as you laid the device down on his workbench, him still not exchanging eye-contact. "We found it during our latest raid on Cerberus, pretty high-tech stuff. Wanted to see if you could help with figuring it out." The scientist paused his work, and turned around to look at you with his usual unreadable neutrality. You didn't mention the part where you kept it to yourself - but you didn't feel it was important enough to mention to Mordin. He didn't really care about letting people in on things, instead just doing what he presumably just thought was the right thing. "It has instructions on it, and I hope they'll help." After a amount of curious studying from Mordins part, he finally spoke up. "I see. Will get to work on it when I've got the time, will tell you when study is finished."

"Great."

You weren't worried about leaving it with Mordin, but the thing that gnawed at you was your intense feeling of curiosity. It was best to just leave it be and get some results from Mordin, but at the same time you desperately wanted to know... Did it really work as it should?

122.content:
Jane decided not to push TOO many boundaries (for now). Giving the device a test-run was the idea, but even then it felt "safer" to perform it on another human being. Human into another human, basically. Granted, the idea of becoming an alien was a once-in-a-lifetime-opportunity (not to mention quite... exotic), but if it would come to that, she'd rather play it safe first. Or well, as safe as anything involving the device could be. In other words, not very.

In a moment's notice, Shepard found herself in the elevator, hovering her index finger over the icons, her thoughts playing a session of mind-Pong. The device made her indeceisive; there were a vast amount of humans on the ship, and with the supposed power of the device, she could pick anyone of them, no questions asked or answered. Because of the lack of restrictions, her mind ran amok. Did she want to play it even safer and go with a girl? Try out being a guy? Tall or short? Techie or Biotic? The possibilities felt absurdly limitless, and it really wasn't a good thing (at least not for her current situation). The device felt cold against your bare hand, a contrast to the wet warmth building up in your grip.

You weren't sure why, but your mind settled on Ashley. Maybe it was because she was the one you had known the longest, and she reminded you of yourself in ways, or maybe you just had a thing for her. Either way, you had decided on her, for better or worse. You imagined that you could find her on Starboard, at least if you were lucky. Apart from Samara (who only visited the Starboard on random intervals) possibly showing up, she'd be completely alone, which made your plan even easier.

The first thing Shepard noticed as the door opened was the back, belonging to none other than her target, Ashley Williams. Judging from her pose, she seemed to be in thought, idly looking out at the vast reaches of space spanning outside the thickened plate glass. As soon as the door had closed however, the second human spectre was nothing but a pile of empty skin and clothes on the floor.

Shepard wasn't as prepared as she thought that she was. Maybe it was the fact that the device actually worked flawlessly, or how she actually made her friend and fellow soldier into nothing more than a wearable suit. Nevertheless, she did her best to swallow her guilt and got to work.

The hollow skin had somehow gotten itself a opening on its back, which Shepard figured to be what she'd have to use to enter. First, her feet went in, followed by her arms and chest, sticking rather loosely to her like the oddest bodysuit to ever exist. Lastly, she took a deep breath, and threw the head-mask over her own, closing the opening as she did. In the matter of what seemed to be a second, her body changed into that of who the skin belonged to; Ashley. Meeting her gaze reflected on the Starboard-window was now Ashley Williams, and nobody else. "This is incredible!" you uttered as you oogled your new body. This however got cut short as you could hear the sound of steps emmanating from the other side of the door.

When Samara entered, she was met with the sight of a lone Ashley Williams, adjusting something on her uniforms arm. Samara's presence soon caught her eye, and she gave her a nod and a smile.

She simply couldn't believe what she'd done to Ashley, and she also couldn't deny how amazing it felt to be wearing another woman's skin as her own.

As the elevator slowly proceeded upward, she cooped a feel again on her perfect chest, smirking a bit over her foolery. When the doors opened up, she strutted into hers - or well, Shepards cabin, and sat her shapely butt on the bed, laying down and just relaxing, taking in the bizarre yet intense and intoxicating sense of wearing someone over herself like this.

A bit of teasing and stroking herself later, she came to realize something; Samara had wanted to see her, but for what exactly? Had she found out something? She couldn't have known, that much was evident, so what was it about?

"...Ahem. EDI, please tell Samara that Commander Shepard wants to see her!" "Understood, Shepard." Shepard? How did she - Oh yeah, it was EDI. EDI basically WAS the ship, and saw everything going on the ship, so there wasn't much to hide from her unless you had the tech for it... Which she didn't. Either way, EDI didn't protest, hence she imagined Samara was soon on her way up to her cabin to discuss... Whatever she needed to speak to her about. Either way, she had some time to spend, but on what?

On one hand, she wanted to check more of Ashley's lovely well-toned body, and on the other she was a strict military-type, or rather a Spectre, doing the Council's dirty-work. She didn't really want to show the secret device off just yet, though...

"Who'd think Ash would make such an amazing outfit!" she giggled in her subordinate's voice, before making her way up the several steps leading to the small bathroom. Samara...

123.content:
Garrus.

You weren't entirely sure as to why Garrus ended up being your first decision for a guinea-pig, but a few ideas popped up throughout your mind. First of all, he was one of the actual "male" aliens on the ship, or male in the human sense of the word. Wrex, Grunt, Mordin and Thane also fit that description however, which made you feel a tad stupid, if not simply ignorant. If anything, you'd probably just have to admit something to yourself; something about Garrus simply made you lust after him. Maybe it just was the voice, or maybe something felt incredibly exotic about him being a turian. He was an entirely different culture and species (two things that were the same for all the others), but even then... He felt... Special? Part of you wanted to say that it was the voice, and part of you wanted to say it was the fact that he was a turian; part of you just told yourself to get on with it, which is what you decided to give up and stick with. Nothing was going to be accomplished if you just stood here and fought yourself over what attracted you to Garrus. It was just better to move on, and get things done.

You decided to take things in your own hands, and took the device with you to the Quarters where you'd always find Garrus; calibrating the Normandy's vast weaponry, making sure it worked at the absolute peak. The fact that the room was also on the opposite side of everything else in the vast area made things for the better. You moved swiftly over to his door, greeting everyone you walked past. Some of them had a studying look on their faces, presumably wondering why you seemed like something was going to come down, but nobody dared to ask you (and you didn't feel like explaining).

The door opened up after working its locks for a couple of seconds, and as you imagined, Garrus was busy - Not with calibrating, but rather disassembling his trademark Mantis. You assumed that it was due to maintenance, and didn't press the issue. Garrus didn't notice you at first, probably too engaged in the maintenance, but soon enough he turned his head, with a rather surprised look on his face (or well, as surprised as a Turian could look). "Ah, Shepard. What can I do for you?"

The device hung loosely in your hand, and you bit your lip slightly. "Well, I kind of wanted help with testing something", you began. The turian rose, and looked directly at you, a sense of curiousity around him like an aura. "I'm not sure if I'm the very scientific type, Shepard, but if it involves field-work I could probably lend you a hand." Were you going to tell him what this was about, or not? "I guess you could call it field-work, yeah... Not really the type you'd expect, though." No, you weren't going to tell him. With a slight wrist-move, you aimed the device at the turian before he could answer or notice the device. It took about a second, before the Turian and his armor fell clumsily to the ground with a loud thud.

Deep inside, you were completely shocked, both at what had transpired, and the fact that you were behind it. At the same time, you knew that you just had to swallow and move on. You did this for a reason, but even then you kind of felt nervous about it. It was someone else, after all. Removing Garrus hollow body through the now completely hollow opening around the neck-area of the armor, you placed the skinsuit on the floor in front of you. You made sure to have the door be locked, and got to work.

The fact that Garrus was a vastly different species kind of worried you, while at the same time you felt that it would really test the abilities of the device. Turning a human into a male(!) turian just like that would really be something to write home about. Turians were covered in chitin, which made parts of Garrus harder than she expected. Nevertheless, she now stood completely naked, prepared to become a male turian, so thinking it through now felt like a rather dumb idea. Starting with the legs, she noted how odd turian legs were compared to a humans. at the least, they looked incredibly odd on a human, as they probably should. Next came the arms, with made it easier for her to keep control over everything she held in her hands. Next came his chitin-covered head, and lastly came the head. She wasn't exactly sure what she was supposed to expect, but she closed the opening on the back anyway. In what seemed like a second, she had grown, become an entirely new species, and Garrus Vakarian. She was now He, and that He was Garrus Vakarian. "Woah." was all that came out of your oddly-shapen "mouth" which, while entirely alien, felt completely natural to you. Best yet, it had his voice. Exhilirated, you took a deep breath.

"Ahem! This is Garrus Vakarian, of the SSR-2 Normandy!" You were absolutely shocked by how smoothly the voice came out, but nevertheless you loved it. Another part of you also seemed to enjoy it, growing outward like a branch. Part of you was surprised, yet lust soon took over that job. You started to move your new arms slowly over your chitin, enveloping in their harsh structure. They moved over your new waist, and eventually one of them found them around your turian genitals, and a low growl, similar to something from a beast, erupted from your absolutely alien mouth. God damn was it sensitive, and you wanted so much more of it. Soon after however, part of you started to come to attention. As intoxicating as the whole experience was, you felt that furiously masturbating as Garrus really wasn't the best idea. It'd have to wait, or else you could find yourself a partner. With some help of his memories, you managed to get your suit of armor on, followed by the odd headpiece he always insisted on wearing, which activated with a loud beep. Being a turian felt incredible to say the least, but the question was; how much of a turian were you now?

According to the genitals acting up against the insides of your armor, quite a lot. You defininitely wanted a test-drive of being a turian, and immediately.

1231.content:
Walking as an entirely different species was easier than "he" had expected. Were you just so good at it from the start, or had the device helped you along with learning how to walk like a real Turian? Regardless, it felt completely natural, and it was as weird as it was comforting. Walking had been a bit of a worry, but since it wasn't a problem, well...

But how much of a Turian were you, really? You FELT like you actually were the Turian you looked and acted like, Garrus Vakarian - but were you really him (physically)? Well, if anyone could help you with finding out, it was the friendly space-neighbor doctor, Karin Chakwas.

The stroll over to her offices from the Battery room was rather brief due to the short distance, and you found Chakwas working on something on her computer. u couldn't tell what it was from over her shoulder (too much of her frame shielded the contents of the screen from your eyes), but judging from her body language she was quite engaged in it. In other words, it was probably something important. Seeing as how she was a military doctor trained in field work however, interrupting her shouldn't be a biggie. Besides, you just wanted to go for a quick check-up. ...Hopefully without shots.

"Doctor Chakwas?" you asked, leaning against the open door-frame.

Chakwas promptly stopped doing whatever she was doing on the computer and turned around to meet your Turian eyes. "Yes, Garrus?"

"I... Wanted to do a quick check-up. You know, just make sure I'm healthy. Been feeling a bit... Under the weather."

"I never took you for the superstitious type, Garrus." She eyed you curiously while you nervously stepped into the room, closing the automatic door behind you. "Well... No, I guess something has just got over me."

She nodded, her face unchanged from her calculative and doctor-like neutrality. "...Alright then, have a seat."

The check-up was more akin to something you were used to than you first had expected. With an entirely different anatomy, it was weird, yeah - but even then a human being and a Turian seemed to be fairly similar to humans, with a few key differences (like the mandibles, or the incredibly thick carapace). It also went surprisingly quickly, and before you knew it you were done, and apparently Chakwas hadn't suspected a thing. Her desire to help overshadowed her suspicion, you guessed.

Well, the test at least revealed your big, running question - Yes, you were completely, 100% Turian when wearing Garrus.

Well, why not have some fun while relaxing from the galactic warfare?

He could be deep with his word at time and some of his words really made your heartbeat race faster. But first, appropriate greeting...in Garrus way. "Oh! hey Tali. I...I was wandering around when err...when this door pad was acting crazy. I thougt it was malfunctioning so I tried to fix it." You tried to act nervous and get a relieve when Tali had no doubt that you were really Garrus.

She looked at the pad. "From my inspection, I clearly confirm you it was working properly Garrus."

"Oh...well then." You acted out like you were in an awkward situation. "maybe because I already...fix it?"

Tali let out a sighed but you thought you spot some expression on her mask that resemble to human's smirking. "What the real reason for visiting my domain, Garrus?"

"...Err you know...it was simple actually." You looked away. "I...think your helmet look sexy...and your purple suit really bring out the supportive waist of yours."

At first you think she was ready to slap you in the face but she end up let out a laugh that you never heard her laugh before. "Oh you are really ridiculous, Garrus. You are so bold and naive."

"Wha..What?" You acted like a dumbstruck Garrus. "What do you mean?"

"I mean..." Then she came closer, destroy space between you and her. Her arms moved up, hug you above shoulder and move her helmet really close to your Turian's one. "Why don't you just said a simple word for your simple action like...You are interesting in me instead of some aspect of my body."

You tried to bring something in your Turian body to acted out like human's blushing as much as possible. "You don't mind if my mandibles may have gotten hook to your helmet?"

She let out another laugh. "Garrus oh Garrus you sure don't stop to amuse me." Her fingers started to move along your mandibles. "I never will mind your precious and cute mandibles of yours as long as you would never mind my intention to use you for your body."

You definitely hit a jackpot.

"You are so mean." You let out a final hook line. "But I'm okay with that."

Being a male alien...being garrus was so much fun.

You felt so free for the first time in your life. No more expectation from your subordinates. No more heavy burden of galactic warfare on your shoulder.

And right now...to had a dance with a beautiful purple clad alien girl.

In her room.

A calming jazz like music...even though there’s some alien rhythm to it...it was just perfect to your ears right now.

...

You stopped your chaotic thought and focused on your beautiful partner.

But more importantly, you felt something warm inside your chest. A feeling that you never had felt before. It increased every time you look at her on the mask where her eyes should have been. Every time you step in synch with her.. Every time you hold her hands, lead the dance and she hold yours, followed your movement.

You like this feeling.

You...love this feeling.

You wish this moment will never be stopped.

Both of you continued to dancing for a while, you never notice how you two end up hold each other in a hug. You didn’t know who was initiated it, but neither of you mind the closeness. The dance continued, more slower and more intimate.

“You know, Garrus.” Tali closed her eyes, resting her head on her partner’s armored chest. “I had dreamed of this day since Shepard has died...for first time.”

You startled by her words. “ What do you mean by that?”

She noticed you were panicking. “I don’t mean it like that. Shepard is my friend. When she had died, I was devastated. I have lost so many members of my family, but her death effected me the most.”

You looked at her. Your mandible couldn't form a word to say.

“Because it was unthinkable.” She continued. “Shepard still got a bright future. She’s still so young. My brethren are close to their death door with weak immunology, but hers? Her death taught me many things.”

You noticed a waver in her voice. You hold her tighter to let her know that you were here.

“One of those is fear.” Her body were shaking. You slowed down to let her rest for a moment. She calmed down a little. “To be afraid of the unthinkable, anything can happens at anytime.”

She stopped and raised her head to met yours.

“And the worst fear...” She touched your face...Garrus’s face with her left hand. “I can’t bare the thought that I will lose you too.”

Before you could do anything, she lifted her mask up, showing a glimpsed of her purple face and glowing eyes.

Then she met her lips with yours.

You always have me.” The words were leaving your mouth without so much thought. “ I will always be at your side”

info.brief_description: The crew of the Normandy gets into some shenanigans with the help of some new equipment.
info.description:
Under one of the latest skirmishes against a Cerberus base, Shepard and his/her team uncovered a treasure trove of experimental technology, ranging from gigantic plasma weaponry that could probably tear a hole through any imaginable alloy to tiny technological "toys" with odd but incredibly unique features. As it turns out, one of these small "toys" ended up on the Normandy, in the hands of one Commander Shepard. He/She wasn't quite sure how he/she had actually managed to carry it with them (the tech they actually barged was air-lifted, not touched by any existing extremities), but somehow a finicky piece of tech had practically attached itself to his/her armor.

As she/he was completely alone in their cozy little room, she decided to play around with the thing by himself/herself. After a bit of looking for any kind of button or lock or anything at all to indicate the item was something on its own, she/he finally made the thing emit a faint buzzing sound, and what looked like a barely visible dot appeared on his/her wall, with no obvious effects whatsoever.

Playing around with it some more opened up a hologram of the items instructions; apparently, the apparatus was the "ultimate disguise tool"; it transforms any living being into a hollow suit, that can be worn to transform the wearer into the creature or individual the suit originally was. Putting on and removing the suit would be enabled by a tiny zipper that appeared on the back and/or front of one's new body, depending on the anatomy of said creature. This zipper would only appear if the user wills it, making it incredibly easy to hide. One would also be able to get every single detail and powers the being inhibited; non-biotics could become biotics and vice versa, among other things. The device also had a unfinished feature, which would let the user partially explore most of the beings mind, allowing the user to pass off as the being much easier. The device also transforms the user completely into the being down to the DNA once the suit is sealed, but the user is able to return to their original form once the suit is removed. The user retains full control over themselves, even when tapping into the suits mind and personality. The user always stays in control, and never loses it.

While completely shocked at first, Shepard soon started to realize the potential this thing had...


----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

As you can see in the rather brief backstory, this is a interactive story about characters in the Mass Effect universe. First of all, please expect spoilers! While this story is placed in an alternative universe where every crewmember in the entire series are collected upon the Normandy, and everyone is alive (including both Virmire survivors). This is to make it much easier to just get into the story, rather than dwell on tiny decisions (like if you want to do ME3 or ME2). However for characters that are NOT part of the Normandys crew, all is fair game (these can be killed off or not depending on your choice, that is entirely up to you).

The main idea of the interactive part is that the story always goes in two directions, following the spirit of the games: you either go the Paragon-route, or you go the Renegade-route (or Paragon-Renegade-Paragon or whatever, do what you want with it). The main concept is that the routes split into these two directions, and then things continue from there. Also important to note is that the Paragon-choice always starts with a capital P (P: Do this thing!), and Renegade-choice with a capital R (R: Do this thing but in a badass way!)

Rules for this story:
* Paragon or Renegade-choice (explanation how that works above) only!
* Sex of all forms is okay! (Rape however, is out of the question) Descriptive sexual scenes are also a-okay, but try to keep it a bit classy!
* Anybody could romance whoever! (So yes, you can totally pair Jack and Grunt together by some miracle)
* PLEASE proofread your stuff before you post!
* On another note, please don't write one single sentence (or two-three) and pass it off as an entry. I know it's often a very arduous task to actually come up with a lengthy and good entry, but please try your best!
* Do not copy any other entry and pass it off as your own. Entries that are blatantly copied from other entries will be removed.
* Even if this story is limited to one fandom, please try to let your imagination flow! I'm very sure you can come up with some great entries that way!
